result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Willando Hunter

records.addlTxt: Signed and filed: Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated February 6, 2023
Received and Filed: Proposed Scheduling Order for Jury Trial Dated February 6, 2023

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for Rafael Willando Hunter.  Attorney Amanda Korin Kirklewski in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Scheduling Order signed and filed by the Court.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 6, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court, defendant Rafael Willando Hunter not in court, in custody.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
OFF THE RECORD. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Amanda Korin Kirklewski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court, in custody.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Attorney Romenesko to be appointed in this matter. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court with attorney Colleen A Taylor.  Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in custody.  Dax Odom appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael Willando Hunter appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rafael Willando Hunter in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Initial appearance scheduled for this date 3/28/2022. Defendant is in custody at MSDF. Needs to be produced for court.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 3/28/22 @ 2p
